name: Three Digits Become Six
description:
Write a function named `three_digits_become_six`. The function takes a single parameter, which is a three-digit `integer`. Your function should return a six-digit `integer` that repeats the three-digit number without using `string` methods or `fstrings`. Additionally, the size of your code is limited to `64` characters in length (_inlucding spaces_).


## Examples

- `776` becomes `776776`
- `333` becomes `333333`
- `187` becomes `187187`


You will always be given a three-digit integer, so no need to validate input ~ Good luck!
